chart_metadata.name: ddns-updater
chart_metadata.description: Lightweight universal DDNS Updater with web UI

runAsContext.description: DDNS Updater runs as any non-root user.

groups.name: User and Group Configuration
groups.description: Configure User and Group for DDNS Updater

attrs.label: DNS Provider Configuration
attrs.description:
Configuration for DDNS Updater.</br>
Choose your provider in the following link for more information </br>
https://github.com/qdm12/ddns-updater#configuration

attrs.label: Cloudflare Zone ID
attrs.description:
Cloudflare Zone ID. </br>
You can find it in the Overview tab of your domain.

attrs.label: Cloudflare Proxied
attrs.description:
Cloudflare Proxied. </br>
True = Proxied </br>
False = DNS Only

attrs.label: GCP Credentials
attrs.description:
GCP Credentials.</br>
Paste the JSON content in this field

attrs.label: Update Period
attrs.description:
Default period of IP address check, following this format:</br>
5m = 5 minutes</br>
1h = 1 hour</br>
1h30m = 1 hour 30 minutes

attrs.label: Update Cooldown Period
attrs.description:
Duration to cooldown between updates for each record.
This is useful to avoid being rate limited or banned,
following this format:</br>
5m = 5 minutes</br>
1h = 1 hour</br>
1h30m = 1 hour 30 minutes

attrs.label: Backup Period
attrs.description:
Set to a period to enable zip backups of data/config.json and
data/updates.json in a zip file following this format:</br>
0 = disabled</br>
10h = 10 hours</br>
20h30m = 20 hours 30 minutes

attrs.label: HTTP Timeout
attrs.description:
Default timeout for HTTP requests, following this format:</br>
10s = 10 seconds</br>
1m = 1 minute</br>
1m30s = 1 minute 30 seconds

attrs.label: Public IP DNS Timeout
attrs.description:
Public IP DNS query timeout, following this format:</br>
3s = 3 seconds</br>
1m = 1 minute</br>
1m30s = 1 minute 30 seconds

attrs.label: Shoutrrr Addresses
attrs.description:
List of Shoutrrr addresses to send notifications to. </br>
See https://containrrr.dev/shoutrrr/0.7/services/overview/ for more information.

attrs.label: Public IP DNS Providers
attrs.description: Providers to obtain the public IP address (IPv4 and/or IPv6)

attrs.label: Public IP HTTP Providers
attrs.description: Providers to obtain the public IP address (IPv4 and/or IPv6)

attrs.label: Public IPv4 HTTP Providers
attrs.description: Providers to obtain the public IPv4 address

attrs.label: Public IPv6 HTTP Providers
attrs.description: Providers to obtain the public IPv6 address

attrs.label: Public IP Fetchers
attrs.description: Fetcher types to obtain the public IP address

attrs.label: Additional Environment Variables
attrs.description: Configure additional environment variables for DDNS Updater.

attrs.label: User ID
attrs.description: The user id that DDNS Updater will run as.

attrs.label: Group ID
attrs.description: The group id that DDNS Updater will run as.

attrs.label: Web Port
attrs.description: The port for the DDNS Updater Web UI.

attrs.label: Host Network
attrs.description: Bind to the host network. It's recommended to keep this disabled.</br>

attrs.label: DDNS Updater Data Storage
attrs.description: The path to store DDNS Updater Data.

attrs.label: Type
attrs.description:
ixVolume: Is dataset created automatically by the system.</br>
Host Path: Is a path that already exists on the system.

enum.description: Host Path (Path that already exists on the system)
ixVolume (Dataset created automatically by the system)

schema.valid_chars_error:
Valid CPU limit formats are</br>
- Plain Integer - eg. 1</br>
- Float - eg. 0.5</br>
- Milicpu - eg. 500m

Valid Memory limit formats are</br>
- Suffixed with E/P/T/G/M/K - eg. 1G</br>
- Suffixed with Ei/Pi/Ti/Gi/Mi/Ki - eg. 1Gi</br>
- Plain Integer in bytes - eg. 1024</br>
- Exponent - eg. 134e6

1.0.28.app_readme:
DDNS Updater

DDNS Updater is a lightweight universal DDNS Updater with web UI

When application is installed, a container will be launched with root privileges. This is required in order to apply the correct permissions to the DDNS Updater directories. Afterward, the DDNS Updater container will run as a non-root user (Default: 568). All mounted storage(s) will be chowned only if the parent directory does not match the configured user.
1.0.28.detailed_readme:
DDNS Updater

DDNS Updater is a lightweight universal DDNS Updater with web UI

When application is installed, a container will be launched with root privileges. This is required in order to apply the correct permissions to the DDNS Updater directories. Afterward, the DDNS Updater container will run as a non-root user (Default: 568). All mounted storage(s) will be chowned only if the parent directory does not match the configured user.
